inlineContent.text: A full-screen advertisement that fills the host app’s interface is known as an interstitial ad. In this tutorial we are going to add interstitial ad into our application.
We will continue to build the app, so be sure to follow all the previous tutorials. You can download
which has already implemented all steps from this tutorial.

sections.chapter: Working with the built-in capabilities of the SDK
sections.title: Create and display interstitial ad

inlineContent.text: Let’s create

folder. This will be the screen where we will display the ad.
Create an
and an
. We pass the
to the initialiser, which will be used to create the ad later.
Ads are created in the same way as inline ads, with one difference – the
parameter must be
. Let’s create an ad when the
is displayed.
Now go back to
Add navigation to your new screen and launch the app. If you did everything correctly, you’ll see that the ad has been successfully loaded.
Your
is ready for creating advertisements, and we have already created a list of advertisements. In this section, we will create a single interstitial ad for the future presentation.
We learnt how to create interstitial advertisement. Now, we are ready to present our intertitial ad. In this section, we will display interstitial ad in our app.
Let’s continue the development in our
file.
Now let’s add a button that will show our ad if it is loaded.
The AdSDK provides the enum
to control the state of the interstitial ad presentation. Add it to the
. We will change it when the button is tapped.
If you don’t use the
method, your
object will always be loaded, which means that the ad will be presented to the user immediately when state changed to the
. Otherwise, the ad will be presented immediately after loading.
The last thing we need is a presentation layer. To display interstitial ads,
has an
modifier. Add it to your
and pass the state value from the
Now, if you launch the app, you should see an advert when you tap on the button. Congratulations! But wait, we can’t hide it. We’ll look at how to do this in the next section.
We managed to successfully show the ad, but we would like to be able to close interstitial. In this section, we implement this logic.
Let’s continue the development in our
file. We could hide the ad by simply changing the
to
, but we don’t know when to change it.
is used not only for events related to hiding interstitials. We will look at it in more detail in a
In order to understand when ad should be hidden, we need to use
and pass it when creating ads.
The method we are interested in is
. We need to implement it to make sure that the ad is hidden when it is needed. You can launch the app and make sure it works. Congratulations, we can now display interstitials in our app!
You should not change the state from
to
without using
method. The advert itself knows when it needs to be hidden and asks you to hide it using this method.

abstract.text: do a lot of work under the hood and can send messages about them to the app. In turn, you can monitor and react to it in some way. In this tutorial, we’ll look at what events are handled by
and how we can interact with them.
A key object interface describing the advertisement.
Sometimes you need to handle taps in your own way. For example, to display ads in the internal browser in the app. In this tutorial, we will learn how to customise the SDK’s tap handling behaviour.
In this tutorial, we will learn how to create custom ads using AdSDK. This process is the same for both inline and interstitial ads.

The SDK supports a persistent cache with resources related to ad, these can be banners or other resources, depending on the type of ad. In this tutorial, we’ll look at how an application developer can control the cache.
In this tutorial, we will learn how to create custom ads using AdSDK. This process is the same for both inline and interstitial ads.

AdSDK provides powerful functionality for user tagging and conversion tracking. In this tutorial, we will look at this functionality.
This tutorial will guide you how to create and display inline ads. An inline ad is an ad created to be displayed in your view hierarchy.
We already know how to create and perform

. However, each of them can have additional parameters, which are called global parameters because they are specified globally for all requests. The SDK provides the ability to add global parameters once so that you don’t have to copy them when creating each request.
